analyzed: 'jug pa ye shes snang ba dam pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las / yid la mi byed pa'i chos rnams dge ba'o //
translated: In the noble Sūtra of the Ornament of the Light of the Pure Gnosis That Penetrates the Domain of All Buddhas, it says:🔽The phenomena that are not mentally engaged are virtuous.🔽The phenomena that are mentally engaged are nonvirtuous.

original: yid la byed pa'i chos rnams mi dge ba'o zhes ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i chos rnams mi dge ba'o zhes ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: kun du rtog pas ma brtags pa //🔽rab tu mi gnas pa yi yid //
analyzed: kun du rtog pas ma brtags pa // rab tu mi gnas pa yi yid //
translated: Not imagined by conceptualization,🔽the mind does not abide.

original: dran pa med cing yid byed med //
analyzed: dran pa med cing yid byed med //
translated: Without mindfulness and without mental engagement,

original: dmigs pa med la phyag 'tshal 'dud //
analyzed: dmigs pa med la phyag 'tshal 'dud //
translated: I pay homage and bow to the absence of reference points.

original: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las //
translated: And similarly, in the Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality, it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par rtog pa thabs kyi mtshan ma ni snang ba la rtog pa ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par rtog pa thabs kyi mtshan ma ni snang ba la rtog pa ste //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva’s conceptual signs of skillful means are conceptualizations of appearances.

original: yid la mi byed pa'i yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa'i yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of mental non-engagement.

original: mdo sde gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzhung mangs kyis dgos pas 'dir ma bris so //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzhung mangs kyis dgos pas 'dir ma bris so //
translated: I have not written more here about the scriptures of the other schools because it would be too much.

original: da ni gzhan brjod pa tshig 'di ni mdo sde pa'i tshig nyid de /
analyzed: da ni gzhan brjod pa tshig 'di ni mdo sde pa'i tshig nyid de /
translated: Now, this statement by the other party is the statement of the Sautrantikas,

original: sngags kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: sngags kyi ma yin no //
translated: not of the Mantranaya.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo sde rnams las mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes //
analyzed: mdo sde rnams las mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes //
translated: Because it is seen in the sutras.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: he badzra las gsungs pa //🔽ngo bo nyid kyis sems med cing //
analyzed: he badzra las gsungs pa // ngo bo nyid kyis sems med cing //
translated: It is stated in the Hevajra Tantra:🔽There is no mind by its very nature,

original: sems byung ba 'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: sems byung ba 'ang med pa'o //
translated: and there are no mental factors.🔽And:

original: de bzhin / gang phyir yid kyis ma bsgoms na //
analyzed: de bzhin / gang phyir yid kyis ma bsgoms na //
translated: Since it is not cultivated by the mind,

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
translated: it is cultivated in all beings.

original: zhes pa'i don gyis yid la mi byed pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don gyis yid la mi byed pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of this is mental non-engagement.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: rgyud na'ang yod de med par dgag pa ni med pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud na'ang yod de med par dgag pa ni med pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It exists in the tantras, because negation is the object of non-existence.

original: dngos po med par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be expressed as non-entity.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: yod pa'i dngos po'i dgag pa ni med par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po'i dgag pa ni med par dgag pa'o //
translated: The negation of an existent thing is a nonimplicative negation.🔽Or, it is the negation of the consequence of a nonconsequence.

original: yang na thal ba med pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa ni med pa dgag pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na thal ba med pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa ni med pa dgag pa'o ;
translated: This is a nonimplicative negation.

original: / ji ltar rgyal po'i btsun mo nyi ma mthong ba ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: / ji ltar rgyal po'i btsun mo nyi ma mthong ba ni 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the queen of the king sees the sun.🔽And it is said that such a one is not human.

original: 'di lta bu mi min zer zhes pa yang rgyal po'i chung ma de shin tu sbas pas nyi ma yang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu mi min zer zhes pa yang rgyal po'i chung ma de shin tu sbas pas nyi ma yang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: The queen of the king is so well guarded that she does not even see the sun.

original: 'dir bkag pa'i nyi ma med par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bkag pa'i nyi ma med par ma byas pa'o //
translated: Here, the negation of the sun is not made non existent.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rgyal bo'i chung ma rnams gang gis nyi ma mthong ba yod na de 'gog pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal bo'i chung ma rnams gang gis nyi ma mthong ba yod na de 'gog pa ste //
translated: It is the negation of the seeing of the sun by the queens of the king, if it exists.🔽And in the case of nonattention, it is the negation of the existence of the object and subject, etc.

original: yid la mi byed pa la yang yid la byed pa gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par yod pa de 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa la yang yid la byed pa gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par yod pa de 'gog pa ste /
translated: , which is attended to.

original: yang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so.

original: 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: 'di la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault here.

original: gang gi tshe las 'di skad 'chad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las 'di skad 'chad de /
translated: When this is explained, it is as follows.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid la @139b mi byed pa'o snyam sems na de'i phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid la @139b mi byed pa'o snyam sems na de'i phyir brjod pa /
translated: If you think that the characteristic of eternalism and nihilism is not mental activity, then to address that,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par yid la byed pa yid la mi byed na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par yid la byed pa yid la mi byed na /
translated: if mental activity in terms of eternalism and nihilism, etc. is not mental activity,

original: de dag gis ni chags pa thams cad la gnod par byed pa ste yid la mi byed pa'i sgra yis so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni chags pa thams cad la gnod par byed pa ste yid la mi byed pa'i sgra yis so //
translated: then they are harmful to all attachments, by the word “mental activity.”

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān in the Avatārameghā Dhāraṇī says,

original: rigs kyi bu rgyu gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la yid la byed pa zhes brjod //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyu gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la yid la byed pa zhes brjod //
translated: “Son of noble family, by what cause is the sphere of non-conceptuality called mental activity?

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma las yang dag par 'das na blang pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma las yang dag par 'das na blang pa'o //
translated: When one has transcended the signs of all conceptuality, it is taken up.

original: de dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: By those, the transcendence of all conceptuality is taught,

original: yid la byed pa'i sgra yis so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i sgra yis so //
translated: by the word ‘mental activity.’

original: ma yin par brtags pa'i phyogs kyang skyon med de /
analyzed: ma yin par brtags pa'i phyogs kyang skyon med de /
translated: The position that it is not so is also faultless.

original: bram ze ma yin par khrid la shog ces pas bram ze dang 'dra ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa khrid la shog ces pa gsal gyi //
analyzed: bram ze ma yin par khrid la shog ces pas bram ze dang 'dra ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa khrid la shog ces pa gsal gyi //
translated: The phrase bring those who are not brahmins is to be understood as meaning bring kings and so on who are like brahmins.

original: rigs mi mthun pa shing rta mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa shing rta mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Come with those who are not Brahmins! This means: Come with kings and so on who are like Brahmins, not with those of different castes, such as charioteers.

original: 'di la yang rang bzhin med pa'i rig pa la gnas par byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang rang bzhin med pa'i rig pa la gnas par byas pa ste /
translated: Here, one should abide in the knowledge of essencelessness.

original: de dag gis ni sgyu ma lta bur gnyis su med par smra bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sgyu ma lta bur gnyis su med par smra bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these, one abides in the non-dual teaching of illusion.

original: gang las chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang las chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: From what would the consequence of nihilism follow?

original: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad tsam ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa'i tha snyad tsam ste /
translated: However, it is merely the convention of non-existence.

original: tshig 'di ni gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni gnyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: This word should be uttered twice.

original: sgyu ma'am yang dag par grub pa med pas yod pa 'gegs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'am yang dag par grub pa med pas yod pa 'gegs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that existence is negated because of being either an illusion or truly established.

original: de med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not that it does not exist.

original: rigs pa 'di yis 'gro ba 'gegs pa'i don ni nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di yis 'gro ba 'gegs pa'i don ni nyams par 'gyur //
translated: By this reasoning, the meaning of refuting the world is lost.

original: 'dir brjod pa tsam byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa tsam byas pa'o //
translated: Here, it is merely stated.

original: ai yig gtso bor gyur pa'i yid la byed pa ni yid la mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: ai yig gtso bor gyur pa'i yid la byed pa ni yid la mi byed pa ste /
translated: The mental attention that is primary with the letter i is non-mental attention.

original: lo ma'i rgyal po bzhin tshig dbus ma phyis pa'i bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma'i rgyal po bzhin tshig dbus ma phyis pa'i bsdus pa'o //
translated: The collection of the middle words without the king of leaves.

original: de gang gis ni yid la byed pa gang yin pa thams cad ni aa ste skye ba med pa'i don to //
analyzed: de gang gis ni yid la byed pa gang yin pa thams cad ni aa ste skye ba med pa'i don to //
translated: By what? Whatever mental activity is, is a, which means non-arising.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bstan zhe na //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bstan zhe na //
translated: What was taught by the Lord?

original: skye ba med pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gis aa yig ces bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gis aa yig ces bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: By the words “non-arising,” this is called the letter a.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sngags kyi le'u las kyang /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sngags kyi le'u las kyang /
translated: Also, in the chapter on the mantra of Hevajra,

original: aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpan na tvat ta zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'di'i don yang chos thams cad thog ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir pa'i sgo gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpan na tvat ta zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di'i don yang chos thams cad thog ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir pa'i sgo gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: it is said, “a kara ro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām, adyanutpannatvataḥ” and so on.

original: aa zhes ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du sbyar ro //
analyzed: aa zhes ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of this is that since all phenomena are primordially non-arisen, the letter a is applied as the characteristic of non-arising.🔽Also, in the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī,

original: de star yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
analyzed: de star yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
translated: it says,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi @140a * //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi @140a * //
translated: “A is the supreme of all letters,

original: mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: the sublime letter of great meaning,

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: arisen from within, unborn.”

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste // zhes pa ste /
translated: and is free from verbal expression.

original: yang na 'dir aa ni bdag med pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: yang na 'dir aa ni bdag med pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Or else, here a is the seed of non-self.

original: de skad du yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: de skad du yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
translated: And so it is said in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: a'a li dang po ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: a'a li dang po ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: The first a is Nairatmya.

original: de dag gis ni yid la byed pa thams cad bdag med pas rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni yid la byed pa thams cad bdag med pas rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this it is said that all mental orientations are without self, and so are essenceless.

original: dang po dbyangs yig rang bzhin te //
analyzed: dang po dbyangs yig rang bzhin te //
translated: The first is the nature of the vowels,

original: blo zhes pa ni shes rab brtags //
analyzed: blo zhes pa ni shes rab brtags //
translated: and the mind is the investigation of wisdom.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das shes rab //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das shes rab //
translated: That itself is the Bhagavat,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyor ba nyid //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyor ba nyid //
translated: the perfection stage of union.

original: yang na aa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i tshig la ;
analyzed: yang na aa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i tshig la ;
translated: Or else, a is the word for clearlight transparency,

original: yid la byed pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i tshig ste /
translated: and mental orientation is the word for the selfconsecration.

original: 'di yang aa yang yin la yid la byed pa yang yin pas yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang aa yang yin la yid la byed pa yang yin pas yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: This is also a and mental orientation, and so is nonmental orientation.

original: 'dis ni yid la mi byed pa'i gnas bsam gyis i khyab pa 'od gsal ba bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa zung du 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni yid la mi byed pa'i gnas bsam gyis i khyab pa 'od gsal ba bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa zung du 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This generates the perfect knowledge of the stream of non-mentation, the luminosity of the self-consecration of emptiness, which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, the non-dual union.

original: yid la mi byed pa ston pa bdag med pa gsal ba slob dpon chen po gnyis med rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa ston pa bdag med pa gsal ba slob dpon chen po gnyis med rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The teaching of non-mentation, the illumination of selflessness, composed by the great master Advaya-vajra, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bdzra p'a n'i dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba gnyan chung gis bcom pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bdzra p'a n'i dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba gnyan chung gis bcom pa'o//
translated: The Indian preceptor Vajra-pāṇi and the Tibetan translator Gnyan chung translated it.
